snippet: Harsh remarks from Syria’s minister of information may signal that condemnation from former allies is starting to worry the leadership around President Bashar al-Assad.
abstract: Syria's minister of information, in unusual televised news conference, declares that the refugees fleeing its borders are welcome back, mocks the leaders of Egypt and Turkey for their condemnations and calls the armed opposition unfit for negotiations; his harsh remarks may signal that the leadership around Pres Bashar al-Assad is starting to worry about foreign criticism.

byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut, and a Syrian employee of The New York Times from Damascus, Syria.

lead_paragraph: Harsh remarks from Syria’s minister of information may signal that condemnation from former allies is starting to worry the leadership around President Bashar al-Assad.
